biotools.summary:
Expression Changes Confirm Genomic Variants Predicted to Result in Allele-Specific, Alternative mRNA Splicing.


Information Theory is proven to accurately predict the impact a mutation has on mRNA splicing, and has been used to interpret coding and non-coding mutations that alter mRNA splicing in both common and rare diseases (Caminsky et al., 2014; Burke et al., 2018; Dos Santos et al., 2018; Yang et al., 2017; Caminsky et al., 2016; Mucaki et al., 2016; Peterlongo et al., 2014; Mucaki et al., 2013; Mucaki et al., 2011; Rogan et al., 2003; Rogan et al., 1998; Rogan and Schneider, 1995).
